Package utility

Class errorBoxes

java.lang.Object
utility.errorBoxes
public class errorBoxes extends Object
The errorBoxes class contains methods for handling and displaying error messages to the user
Author:
Arun Rai

      private static javafx.scene.control.Label errorMain

  • Constructor Details

    • errorBoxes

      public errorBoxes()

  • Method Details

    • setHomeLabels

      public static void setHomeLabels(javafx.scene.control.Label label)
      This method is ran once during the initialize method of "home_controller". It sets the Label of where errors will be pasted on the home page. The variable is used many times so setting it once makes it easier to retrieve.
      Parameters:
      label - Label from "home_controller".

    • checkForEmptyErrorBox

      public static void checkForEmptyErrorBox(String errorMessage, javafx.scene.control.Label[] errorLabels)
      This method is called every time a user clicks "Save" on the Customer and appointment pages. It takes all the errorLabels as a parameter from previous input check and clears all the text, so when the new errors appear they are not combined with the old ones to prevent confusion.
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - Message that indicates program to reset labels. Such as "reset".
      errorLabels - Labels to reset.

    • mainErrorboxes

      public static void mainErrorboxes(String error)
      This method is called when program needs to display error message to home screen, such as "Appointment Deleted" or "Appointment not deleted".
      Parameters:
      error - Error Message to display to Home Page.

    • flashMainError

      public static void flashMainError()
      Create a Flash effect for error label on home page, can be called from any class in the program.

      LAMBDA EXPRESSION:

      Lambda expressions are used here to provide a concise and readable way to define the behavior of each KeyFrame in the Timeline, without the need for a separate class or method.
